about.description:
oslex is an OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex.
Its main purpose is to provide functions similar in functionality
to shlex.quote(), shlex.split() and shlex.join() on both Windows
and POSIX-compatible platforms.

This goal is achieved by simply forwarding the calls to either shlex
(from the standard library) on POSIX-compatible systems, or the excellent
mslex library (written by Lawrence D'Anna / @smoofra) on Windows.

In other words, oslex is to shlex/mslex what os-path is to posixpath/ntpath.
about.summary: OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex

about.description:
oslex is an OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex.
Its main purpose is to provide functions similar in functionality
to shlex.quote(), shlex.split() and shlex.join() on both Windows

This goal is achieved by simply forwarding the calls to either shlex

In other words, oslex is to shlex/mslex what os-path is to posixpath/ntpath.
about.summary: OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex

name: oslex
raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: oslex
  version: "0.1.3"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/${{ name[0] }}/${{ name }}/${{ name }}-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1ed4cd82c75df2a8bcb0da34400984183753933155d0c7d999fa533137685f2d

build:
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed -vv
  number: 0
  noarch: python

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - hatchling
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - mslex

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
      - oslex
      pip_check: true
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*

about:
  homepage: https://github.com/petamas/oslex
  summary: 'OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex'
  description: |
    oslex is an OS-independent wrapper for shlex and mslex.
    Its main purpose is to provide functions similar in functionality
    to shlex.quote(), shlex.split() and shlex.join() on both Windows
    and POSIX-compatible platforms.

    This goal is achieved by simply forwarding the calls to either shlex
    (from the standard library) on POSIX-compatible systems, or the excellent
    mslex library (written by Lawrence D'Anna / @smoofra) on Windows.
  
    In other words, oslex is to shlex/mslex what os-path is to posixpath/ntpath.
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  repository: https://github.com/petamas/oslex

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - MementoRC
